item.title: Ann Wilkinson Photography
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Type based identity For the typography, we chose Chaparral Pro, designed by Carol Twombly, a slab serif font that has some subtle wood-cut qualities that make it feel a little more down to earth and less trendy. It’s down to earth look is complimented with the bright and warm color scheme against the mid-toned grey […]

The post Ann Wilkinson Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Type based identity

For the typography, we chose Chaparral Pro, designed by Carol Twombly, a slab serif font that has some subtle wood-cut qualities that make it feel a little more down to earth and less trendy. It’s down to earth look is complimented with the bright and warm color scheme against the mid-toned grey background.

The post Ann Wilkinson Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Alison Gootee
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We created the identity, some print work, and a website for Alison Gootee, a talented photographer working out of her daylight studio in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. A Gorgeous Type-based Logo We chose the self titled font Firmin Didot for it delicate and sophisticated qualities, paired with Zapf’s Optima, which both nicely matched Alison’s photographic style. Website […]

The post Alison Gootee appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We created the identity, some print work, and a website for Alison Gootee, a talented photographer working out of her daylight studio in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

A Gorgeous Type-based Logo

We chose the self titled font Firmin Didot for it delicate and sophisticated qualities, paired with Zapf’s Optima, which both nicely matched Alison’s photographic style.

Website Design

The post Alison Gootee appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: East River Institute
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just finished the identity for the East River Institute, started by Timothy Brutus. We wanted to go with something simple and classic looking, we went with Bodoni for the font. It’s contrast in stroke makes it look really classy, we tracked out the letters and gave some white space around the logo to let […]

The post East River Institute appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just finished the identity for the East River Institute, started by Timothy Brutus. We wanted to go with something simple and classic looking, we went with Bodoni for the font. It’s contrast in stroke makes it look really classy, we tracked out the letters and gave some white space around the logo to let it be nicely placed on any photo (they had a lot of great water-front photography)

East River Institute on Tumblr

The post East River Institute appeared first on mimoYmima.
